Pre-Game Insights: Padres manager Mike Shildt refused to be ruffled by the Dodgers' caginess regarding their starter for Game 5, stating 'Somebody will show up and we'll be ready for him.'
Shildt compared his team's approach to an NFL Hall of Fame coach's, saying 'We're more like Vince Lombardi â€” power sweep, here it is, Yu Darvish is going to start, here's our lineup.'
Yu Darvish, a veteran of playoff elimination games, will start for the Padres in Game 5, despite going 0-4 in such games.
Darvish was serene when speaking to reporters, attributing his calmness to his accumulated experience.
Xander Bogaerts wants the offense to give Darvish a lift, saying 'I feel like if we can give him a little comfort early on, it would be nice.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stakes are high for both teams, as they aim to face the New York Mets in the NLCS beginning Sunday.
The Japanese contingent, including Darvish, Ohtani, and Yamamoto, are eager to compete against each other.
Dodger manager Dave Roberts said Yamamoto 'will be a part of' Game 5 even if he doesn't start.
Ohtani wants Yamamoto to be 'able to see Darvish potentially', as they are good friends.
Darvish conceded that facing off with Yamamoto would be special.
Game 5 starts at 5:08 p.m., airing on Fox 5 San Diego.
